flashcards.english: Nĩ ndĩragucia (I am pulling), Nĩ ngucagia (I normally pull), Nĩ ngucirie (I pulled today), Nĩ ndĩragucirie (I pulled yesterday), Nĩ ndagucirie (I pulled long ago)
flashcards.notes: Complete tense conjugations for verb 'Gucia' (to pull). Shows progressive present, habitual present, near past, middle past, and remote past. Kûgucia = infinitive

flashcards.english: Nĩ tũrãtĩndĩka (We are pushing), Nĩ tũtĩndĩkaga (We normally push), Nĩ tũtĩndĩkire (We pushed today), Nĩ tũrãtĩndĩkire (We pushed yesterday), Nĩ tũdatĩndĩkire (We pushed long ago)
flashcards.notes: First person plural conjugations showing all tense variations. Mirrors the pattern for 'I' conjugations

flashcards.english: Ndĩthambire (I washed), Twĩthambire (We washed), Wĩthambire (You washed), Mwĩthambire (You all washed), Ethambire (He/She washed), Methambire (They washed)
flashcards.notes: Near past tense (-ire suffix) conjugated across all persons. Common phrase: na maĩ mahoro (with cold water). Gũthamba = to wash/bathe/perform ablution

flashcards.english: ũmũthĩ Ndĩthambire na maĩ mahoro (Today I bathed with cold water), Ira ndĩrethambire na maĩ mahoro (Yesterday I bathed...), Iyo ndethambire na maĩ mahoro (Day before yesterday I bathed...)
flashcards.notes: Shows how tense markers change with time references: ũmũthĩ (today), Ira (yesterday), Iyo (day before yesterday). Different verb forms for each time period

flashcards.english: Ndīrarī na mbeca (yesterday I had money), Ndarī na mbeca (long ago I had money)
flashcards.notes: Past tense forms of auxiliary verb 'na' (to have). Ndīrarī = yesterday past, Ndarī = remote past. Compare with present: Ndĩ na mbeca (I have money)
